ETYMOLOGY: Abbreviation of the Latin phrase *Annō Dominī*, meaning 'in the year of the Lord'. This system was devised by Dionysius Exiguus in 525 CE.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An abbreviated form of a phrase, often functioning adverbially to modify a date.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used in dating systems to specify a year within the current era, traditionally counted from the year of the birth of Jesus Christ ('the year of the Lord').
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 公元（缩写），主后；用于指定当前时代（从传统上计算的耶稣基督诞生年开始计数）的年份。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Historians generally agree that Julius Caesar was assassinated in 44 B.C., not A.D. 44.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 历史学家普遍认为尤利乌斯·凯撒是在公元前44年被刺杀，而不是公元44年。
